name: Petit Lafitte

reviews.text: My wife and I traveled here with four children ages 9 to 16. All of the reviews were very accurate. Great food, warm and friendly people, and superior service. We enjoyed very good snorkeling from the beach. We enjoyed a snorkeling trip and parasailing booked at the onsite dive shop. We enjoyed the privacy of cabanas 14 and 15. The pool was fantastic and the other guests and their children were very friendly. We look forward to our next visit. We have already reccomended this hotel to several friends interested in the area. If you are looking for a truly special place, you've found it. Special thanks to Javier, Manuel, Jesus, Daniel and Luis. If you find yourselves in Arizona, me casa es su casa!
reviews.title: You can't go wrong!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed from 7/16 - 7/23.
reviews.title: Just what we needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PS. John and Ginny, Tom and family and Steph and family, we thank you for the time spent and hope your travels home were safe.
reviews.title: Hotel and Staff were wonderful!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled to Petit Lafitte as a couple from July 10th to 17th and that was great.
reviews.title: Something Different

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, we had such a wonderful weather, it didn't rain once during the day - we saw rain showers north and south but not there !
reviews.title: Stay here once, and you will always want to come back!!
Small hotel with a great beach!
reviews.text: So, for my sister's birthday, my brother and I decided to take her and her family to Playa del Carmen. After researching reviews on tripadvisor and prices on expedia, my brother selected Petit Lafitte. This hotel is right on the water nestled a short distance between the Tides and Princess resorts, both much larger. Before each of those resorts, there is a short distance of small homes, undeveloped areas and small businesses. So, although anyone can walk along the public beaches, this small hotel feels somewhat private. The beach is beautiful - great sand, beautiful blue water. Staff raked up the seaweed that made it onto the shore every morning.

The resort itself consists of bungalows or motel-style rooms. We stayed in rooms 301, 302 & 401, all ground floor units in the garden view rooms. Five buildings each have six units. The rooms themselves are tile floored, with two-double beds (fixed on concrete pedestals), refrigerator, TV balanced on said fridge. There is also a coffee pot (ours spilled more than it made) and plenty of bottled water (replenished daily). The room has a sink outside the bathroom with enough countertop space for toiletries. The bathroom itself consists of a toilet and shower. The toilet seat had a very wide base --- I felt like I was going to fall through! Our bed had a bedspread (hate them) and keyed door. My sister's unit had a duvet though -- would have preferred that. The TV had limited English language channels and of those, CNN did not come in clearly. The resort WiFi was hit or miss. The rooms were definitely dated (the resort is the oldest in the area), but still had everything one could need.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is served under a thatched roof area, open air. We speculated on how everything would work in the event of rain, but never experienced an occasion to be able to comment. Fresh fruit, cereal and buns were available buffet style in the mornings along with hot breakfast choices selected from a menu. At breakfast, dinner options were displayed and special dietary requests could be made should the options conflict with dietary needs. Dinner was also partial buffet, partial order. Salads and soups and dessert were available buffet style, entrees made to order.
reviews.title: Fantastic and Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lunch can be ordered near the bar on the deck that overlooks the ocean. Down three steps from the deck are a single line of lounge chairs under the resorts palapas. There were always palapas and lounges available. The bar sometimes closed down early - open as late as midnight, but sometimes closed earlier.
reviews.title: An amazing hotel for an amazing price

reviews.text: The pool is small with more lounge chairs. Often we were the only ones in the pool. A small resort like this immediately lends a sense of comfort and familiarity. My sister was able to allow her children to roam freely without worry.
reviews.title: Perfect, as Usual

reviews.text: Petit Lafitte was the site of our wedding weekend (April 28 - May 1). We had a total of 65 guests at the wedding, and all but four of them stayed at Petit. Of the 60+ that did stay there, the general consensus was pretty much "you couldn't really ask for much better".
reviews.title: Perfect wedding weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There isn't much new we can add to the reviews - they are all pretty accurate. The staff is phenomenal, the food is great, the place is nice, and it's affordable. If you're looking for a place to get married, we highly recommend Petit Lafitte. Their attention to detail was outstanding - nothing was left out. They went out of their way to make sure everything was what we asked for. We really couldn't have asked for more. We found it to be a bonus that since we rented out a majority of the rooms, the hotel closed off the remaining vacant rooms. Thus, the resort was essentially ours. This created a really great vibe for the weekend and also made the wedding day more special, as there were no other weddings to compete with (as is often the case with big, all-inclusive resorts).
reviews.title: Absolute Heaven

reviews.text: The day after the wedding we moved to more "posh" resort a few hundred yards down the beach for a few days of post wedding R&R. We missed the staff, sopes, guacamole, and margaritas so much that we went back there for lunch both days.
reviews.title: Read This, Not That! - Best resort in Playa Del Carmen.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel isn't for everyone - if you're in to the swank, hipster places, try elsewhere. However, if you're looking for a very laid back, intimate setting with a wonderful staff, solid cuisine, decent rooms, and a fantastic piece of beach, this is the place.
reviews.title: WEDDING OF MY DREAMS!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were looking for a place for a totally relaxing break from what had been a very hectic and stressful period of time. Friends of ours have been coming to this resort (and it's previous incarnations) for many years and always raved about it. We wanted quiet and natural beauty, but we also wanted air conditioning and access to the town of Playa del Carmen for evening strolls. We had stayed at some of the mega-resorts in the area and while those were fun, they were definitely not what we were looking for this time.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in June. In spite of the occasional downpour, we loved our bungalow location on the beach and enjoyed swimming in the ocean. The resort is small, friendly and exceptionally well run. We were particularly impressed by the friendliness of all the staff. If you are looking for a relaxing and affordable vacation in a beautiful part of the Mayan Riviera, we would highly recommend Petit Lafitte.
reviews.title: We highly recommend this wonderful place!

reviews.text: My wife, our three year old son and I just spent a wonderful week at Petit Lafitte. We have traveled extensively in Latin America and the U.S., but never have felt as much of a bond to our fellow guests and the staff as we did at Petite Lafitte. The hotel has everything you need, but is small, intimate, and peaceful. A wonderful place -- we'll come back!
reviews.title: An intimate and fun place

reviews.text: Awesome service, delicious food, beautiful beach, fantastic massage ... highly recommended for a relaxing getaway.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: Myself and two sisters spent a glorious week at Petit LaFitte, and had a awesome time.
reviews.title: SIster-get-away at Petit Lafitte

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose bungalow #10, but there are also hotel rooms available as well.
reviews.title: The best service I've ever recieved - attention to detail was supurb!

aka: Petit Lafitte Hotel Playa Del Carmen
